venue.name: All India Shri Shivaji Memorial Society (AISSMS) Campus
venue.address: Kennedy Road, Near RTO, Shivajinagar, Pune
venue.description: A prominent educational complex in Pune, comprising several colleges including engineering, management, and polytechnic. The campus is known for academic activities, cultural fests, and student events.

event_context.likely_event_today: Given it's a Saturday evening, a college cultural fest, annual day celebration, or an inter-college competition could be concluding or ongoing.
event_context.weather_note: February in Pune typically offers pleasant, dry weather, which encourages outdoor activities and does not deter traffic or event attendance.

traffic_prediction.summary: Expect high traffic congestion around the AISSMS campus and surrounding Shivajinagar area, primarily due to the conclusion of a likely college event and general Saturday evening rush. Significant bottlenecks will be observed as a large number of two-wheelers and auto-rickshaws exit the venue simultaneously.

peak_period.label: 8:30 PM – 9:30 PM
peak_period.description: This window represents the peak outflow of attendees from the college event, coinciding with the general Saturday evening traffic in the area.

hourly_levels.description: comma-separated 24 congestion levels (0-100) from midnight to 11PM

impact_zones.roads_affected: Kennedy Road, Shivajinagar RTO Road, internal campus access roads
Narveer Tanaji Malusare Road (Pune-Mumbai Road), Ganeshkhind Road (towards University Circle), Jangali Maharaj Road, Agarkar Nagar roads
University Circle, Model Colony Road, Fergusson College Road (FC Road), parts of Deccan Gymkhana, Shivajinagar Railway Station approach roads
Old Pune-Mumbai Highway (NH48) towards Wakdewadi/Dapodi, Arterial routes connecting to Swargate, Pimpri-Chinchwad

key_factors.detail: Weekend evenings typically see higher traffic volumes due to leisure activities and events, amplifying congestion from college events.
The current time coincides with the general evening rush hour and the conclusion of the event, leading to concentrated outflow.
A high percentage of two-wheelers exiting simultaneously will create bottlenecks and weaving traffic patterns, exacerbating congestion.
Insufficient parking leads to roadside parking, and the tendency for attendees to leave immediately after an event causes sudden, severe surges.

alerts.message: Severe congestion expected around AISSMS campus from 8:30 PM to 9:30 PM due to event conclusion and general Saturday evening traffic.
Parking availability is extremely limited; avoid personal vehicles if possible to prevent further gridlock.

recommendations.best_arrival_window: 04:00 PM – 05:00 PM (for events starting in the evening, to avoid pre-event rush)
recommendations.best_exit_window: After 10:00 PM (to avoid the peak outflow and allow traffic to dissipate)
avoid_roads: Narveer Tanaji Malusare Road (near AISSMS junction)
suggested_routes: For destinations towards Deccan/Kothrud, use alternative inner roads like Ghole Road after bypassing the immediate RTO junction.
For destinations towards University/Baner, consider Ganeshkhind Road after 9:30 PM.
transit_options: Nearest Metro: Shivajinagar Metro Station (Aqua Line) is a short walk away. Highly recommended.
Bus Routes: Numerous PMPML bus stops are available on Kennedy Road and Narveer Tanaji Malusare Road. Expect delays.
recommendations.commuter_tip: Utilize the Pune Metro from Shivajinagar station to bypass the immediate road congestion. For short distances, walking is often faster than navigating through the traffic snarls directly outside the campus.
